definition: perfect match
to cut short/extinct/to disappear/to vanish/absolutely/by no means
variant of 絕|绝[jue2]
to join/to fit/to mate/to mix/to match/to deserve/to make up (a prescription)/to allocate

sentences.english: But happy for the girls can find no allocation.
sentences.chinese: 但求幸福的少女可以找到绝配。

sentences.english: Fried mutton fat with onions goes well with vodka.
sentences.chinese: 油炸肥羊肉伴洋葱，再加上一杯伏特加就是绝配了。

sentences.english: Butter and popcorn was bound to be a match made in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 奶油加上爆米花绝对是来自天堂的绝配。

sentences.english: The green fabric in combination with leather sleeves is a great match.
sentences.chinese: 绿色的面料同皮袖简直是绝配。

sentences.english: So it's always that classic match-up of just like opposites, but it's great to watch and everything.
sentences.chinese: 所以这又是一个经典的两极绝配，很好看的一部剧。

sentences.english: Food Suggestions: Pairs perfectly with red meat, cheeses, sizzling pepper beef and roast duck.
sentences.chinese: 与红肉，干酪，黑椒牛柳和烤鸭堪称绝配。

sentences.english: Food Suggestions: Pairs perfectly with grilled or barbequed meat, mixed salads and red fruit salads.
sentences.chinese: 与扒肉排或烤肉，拌沙拉或红色水果沙拉堪称绝配。

sentences.english: Mr. Branch says Holly McGarvie was a perfect match for Ballou.
sentences.chinese: 布兰奇先生表示，麦加维和Ballou高中是绝配。

sentences.english: Cars and girls go perfectly well together, it is tested by time.
sentences.chinese: 香车美女的绝配，是经得起时间的考验的。

sentences.english: Ice tea is a simple matter, or can be said that perfect match.
sentences.chinese: 奶茶加冰是件简单的事情，或者可以说是绝配。

sentences.english: Silk and eiderdown make a perfect match in a comforter.
sentences.chinese: 用丝绸与凫绒做被子简直是绝配。

sentences.english: “Thatcher and Scargill deserved each other, nobody else did,” he says.
sentences.chinese: “撒切尔和斯卡吉尔真是绝配，”他说。

sentences.english: For coffee lovers, chocolate and coffee are a match made in heaven.
sentences.chinese: 对于咖啡爱好者，巧克力和咖啡真是天造地设的绝配。

definition: a match made in heaven (idiom)
lit. made by Heaven and arranged by Earth(idiom)/ideal/perfect/(of a match) made in heaven/to be made for one another
to match/well-suited
to be well matched/to suit
to bring out the best in each other (idiom)/to complement one another well
to pair up/to match/to arrange in pairs/to add sth into a group
to join/to fit/to mate/to mix/to match/to deserve/to make up (a prescription)/to allocate
to match/in tune/reasonable
first-rate/excellent (loanword from Japanese 一番, ichiban)
tasty/to one's liking
too wonderful for words
to mix and match (of clothing etc)
simply/at all/practically
visually attractive/eye candy/easy on the eyes/to protect the eyes
the brush stroke that dots in the eyes (idiom); fig. to add the vital finishing touch/the crucial point that brings the subject to life/a few words to clinch the point
talented man and beautiful woman/ideal couple
